metadata.description: Combined interview and survey data for persona generation

pain_points: Too many meetings interrupting deep work
goals: Reduce time spent on code reviews
quotes: Invest in developer experience. Good CI/CD, fast builds, helpful error messages - these things compound.
Meetings that could have been emails are my biggest frustration.
When the tools work smoothly, developers are happier and more productive.

pain_points: Lack of proper design system documentation
goals: Get faster access to user behaviour data
quotes: What works for one product might not work for another.
I design with accessibility in mind from the start.
A 'small' copy change can affect the entire layout.

pain_points: Endless meetings leaving no strategic thinking time
Manual data queries for user insights
quotes: My job is to figure out what we should build, why, and when.
I involve engineers in problem discovery so they understand the context.
I've started protecting Thursday mornings for deep work.

pain_points: Poor data quality requiring extensive cleaning
Gap between prototype and production deployment
goals: Spend more time on modelling, less on data cleaning
Improve MLOps tooling and CI/CD for ML
Better educate stakeholders about ML limitations
quotes: I spend probably 60% of my time on data cleaning and preprocessing. The actual modelling is the easy part.
Executives don't want to hear about model performance metrics - they want to know the business impact.
We've had models silently degrade because nobody was watching the right metrics.

pain_points: Being treated as a service desk
quotes: It's easy to spin up resources but hard to track what's actually being used.
When I'm on call at 2 AM, I don't want to reverse-engineer someone's clever automation.
You can't adopt everything, so picking the right battles matters.
